case_vignette: An 81-year-old man comes to the physician because of increased exertional dyspnea and dizziness over the past 8 weeks. He has hypertension for which he takes lisinopril. He has smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for the past 50 years. Physical examination shows weak peripheral pulses. Cardiac examination is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

Final Diagnosis: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
